com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.Plu.noCausesMessage: No problems were identified. If you know why this problem occurred, please add a suitable Cause for it.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Connection Error during ABAP upload
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
An error occurred while connecting to ABAP system
In project portal check the configuration for ABAP upload. If it is correct, create a DLM incident to component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*JCO Exception while trying to retrieve ABAP Destination: Connect to SAP gateway failed.*
.*JCO Connection Exception when processing: : Error when opening an RFC connection .*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Code Check Error
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The build failed because the analysis-plugin code check tool detected a violation of priority "Very High".
The details of the error is available in the "Fiori Analysis Plugin Report" which you can see on the left panel of the Jenkins build page.
In the column "Check" you can find a link to the respective check documentation.
You may also check the console output log for the errors. All indication for fixing errors are in the log.
In case you can not find a solution by yourself or think that this is a false positive, please please create an issue

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Parent Pom not found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The parent pom version you reference was not found on Nexus
Check the version of parent pom you reference in your pom.xml file. Possible error causes: - you reference an old snapshot version that has been deleted from Nexus - typo in your parent pom reference - temporary Nexus issues. In this case create a DLM incident to component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Client does not exist
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The client you provided for the ABAP upload does not exist in the upload system. Check your settings for ABAP upload in project portal and correct. If you are sure they're OK, create a DLM Incident to component DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No hotfix needed.
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: A hotfix is only required if in the maintenance system a version from a milestone release codesplit (MRC) was uploaded. Check your ReleaseContext. Take the highest *SP* ReleaseContext.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*can not be uploaded into Hotfix system.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Request not in status in Process
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The BSP is locked in a workbench request which is not in status "in Process" in correction workbench. In most cases is in status "Testing" . If a new version of the app should be uploaded at first status must be changed to "in Process" in correction workbench in system I7P or the correction must be set to "tested with ok".

Solution:

--> search upload workbench request in your log for example by searching a line like "Currently transport request/task *your request* locks BSP application *your BSP application* )

--> login in I7P

--> navigate to ABAP corr. Measures

--> Search

--> enter transport of upload

--> double click on correction measure number.

In case:

--> If the version in the system should be delivered to customers as note

---> Mark request --> right mouse click --> process Item -->Next status of correction request

or

--> If the version should not be delivered to customers

--> Mark request --> right mouse click --> process Item -->return to Developer ( version in system will be overwritten with the next upload).

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Inconsistent state - BSP locked in transport request but the correction request is not in status.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: wrongly defined dependency (LREP)
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The calculation of the LREP objects fails due to a wrongly defined dependency. In manifest.json a dependency to a library/component is defined which doesn't exists in the system in LREP.

Solution:

--> check depending component is existing in LREP

--> login in upload system

--> call via transaction ‘SA38’ the report ‘/UIF/GET_FILES_4_NS’

--> enter in the field Namespace = *missing component*

--> enter in the field Name = manifest

--> press enter

You should find two entries one with Layer_type = VENDOR and one with Layer_type = LOAD

--> get BSP repository of missing component

--> start project portal https://projectportal.int.sap.hana.ondemand.com/

--> enter in the name of the missing component in search field

--> navigate into the project

--> get from the Fiori/ProjectVersion/masters1/Properties the name of the SAPUI5 Repository ( BSP )

In cases:

--> If only entry with Layer_type = VENDOR exists.

--> call via transaction ‘SA38’ the report ‘/UI5/APP_INDEX_CALCULATE’

--> navigate to tab ‘Single SAPUI5 Repository Only’

--> enter in the field SAPUI5 Repository the name of the depending BSP

--> If no entry occurs the missing component is not defined in a SAPUI5 Repository BSP

--> Navigate via transaction SA80 --> BSP Application --> BSP to the manifest.json of this the SAPUI5 Repository

--> Check that the missing component is defined as component or library in manifest.json

--> Adjust in the manifest.json of your APP the dependency to component which exists in LREP

--> at issues with SAP UI5 libraries or components

--> Check that only existing library or components are entered in the manifest.json

--> To get a list of existing libaries UI5 librariies and components call report GET_UI5_LIBS_COMPONENTS in the upload system

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Virus scan error
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Virus scan error. Solution: Create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN to check the virus scan setting in the system.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: SWCV closed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The software component version (SWC) to which the APP is assigned is closed. SWCV are typically closed at assembly of a support package. (from ECC -> + two weeks ). Solution: Check the milestones of your SWCV. Check whether the enter system in project portal is the right system for the SWCV.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: ZIP file not found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The abap zip file was not found. Check consistence between pom.xml and project portal. ( group ID )

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Communication error to GTADIR
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The communication with GTADIR Server is not possible at the moment. This is in the most cases a temporary problem.
Solution: Retry/rebuild the upload. If rebuild fails , try again after 1 hour . If the issue still persists create a DLM ticket under DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No package
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: No development package assigned in Project portal for project. Request for package creation by creating DLM incident under the component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: mismatch transport layer
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The transport layer of package is not consistent to the transport target in the project portal. Solution: Correct transport target on project portal. If transport target is correct, create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN to change transport target of the development package.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Replication error (LREP)
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: File can't be replicated into LREP create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Error ==> In replication mode files can only be written as local content.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: wrong connection setup
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: System connection for ABAP upload is wrong. Solution: Check your project portal entries for ABAP upload and also see additional required steps here . Just in case that project portal is set up correctly and you followed up all required activities create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: FIORI_TOOLS missing
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The for the automated ABAP upload required tools are missing in the system. Solution: Create an DLM incident to import the tools. Component - DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: downgrade of version not possible
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The version in the system is higher as the version which should be uploaded. Solution: Create a new version, e.g. in maintenance by triggering a new singleAppFlow. If the downgrade is mandatory create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*ERROR: The last uploaded UI Version.*which should be uploaded.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: GIT repository not available
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: GIT repository could not be cloned. Reason could be that the GIT repository is not available for this project or there is a temporary outage of GIT server. Solution: Makes sure there is a valid GIT repository existing for this project. If the GIT server is not available retrigger the upload later.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: User (FIOINFRA) is not authorized to create tasks
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Problem: The user used for upload in the ABAP System is not authorized to create tasks for a Transport Request. Solution: open BCP Ticket on DEV-IW-GEN to assign needed authorization.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: component Local
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The corresponding development package is assigned to software component LOCAL. For uploads which should not be delivered the software component UIERHOME has to used. Solution: Change the software component assignment of the development package of the FIORI app in the backend system..
For a assigment of a corresponding SWC to the package please create a DLM ticket on DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*No development system found for component LOCAL in table FIORI_SYS_LIST.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: another deployment
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Another deployment is still running. This in the most cases a temporary problem. Solution: Restart your Jenkins-Job again.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Rebuild failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The retrigger of ABAP upload jobs fails due to missing environment variables. This is normally a temporary problem. Solution: Rebuild ABAP Upload again.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*FATAL: Null value not allowed as an environment variable: ABAPMSServer.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Upgrade running
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Upgrade still running: Logon not possible. Solution: Rebuild later again.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: BSP locked in corr. req. not in status "In Process"
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Description: BSP locked in transport request but the correction request in i7P is not in status "In Process". Solution: change status of correction request in I7p to "in process".

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*but the correction request is not in status "In Process".*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Release context
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The project is not subscribed correctly to a release context. Solution: Please contact your LOB to correct this !

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Error: Receiving application values for release context:.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: test html5
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The BSP is locked in a workbench request which is not in status "in Process" in correction workbench. In most cases is in status "Testing" . If a new version of the app should be uploaded at first status must be changed to "in Process" in correction workbench in system I7P or the correction must be set to "tested with ok".

Solutions:

--> login in I7P

--> navigate to ABAP corr. Measures

--> Search

--> enter transport of upload search in logfile e,g, "Currently transport request/task WMMK017489 locks BSP application PP_DDREPL_DTS1 )

--> double click on correction measure number.

In case:

--> If the version in the system should be delivered to customers as note

---> Mark request --> right mouse click --> process Item -->Next status of correction request

or

--> If the version should not be delivered to customers

--> Mark request --> right mouse click --> process Item -->return to Developer ( version in system will be overwritten with the next upload.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Missing configuration in translation system
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: User that is used for the up/download jobs misses appropriate authorization for your translation area. Configuration for the translation area has to be completed.. Contact your translation coordinator

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*You don't have authorization for operation PUT_ORIGINAL in translation area.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No POM file found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: there is no POM available for this project

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*there is no POM in this directory.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: could not determine prefix
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: could not determine prefix for a workaround see here

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Empty test suite
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The test step fails as the test runner is trying to run an empty test suite - typically all test in your test suite html page testsuite.qunit.html are commented out. In case you don't want test to be executed you need to remove or rename the test suite file.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Checkmarx Job could not be triggered
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Possible reasons: job is disabled, job does not exist, checkmarx jenkins https://fio-cx.wdf.sap.corp is not reachable.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Remote build failed with 'ExceedRetryLimitException' for the following reason: 'Max number of connection retries have been exeeded.*
.*Possible reasons: job is disabled, job does not exist, checkmarx jenkins is not reachable.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No Test results are found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The OPA5/Qunit tests were started but produce no test results. The test results are supposed to exist in **/target/surefire-reports/TEST*.xml.
This could happen when you have the webapp/test/testsuite.qunit.html in place but contains no tests. Either you don't want to execute tests, in that case rename or remove the test suite file. Or include some tests!

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*No test report files were found.*Configuration error.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No pom.xml found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: There was no pom.xml file found in your project's base directory. Please create one.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*There was an issue reading the projects pom.xml.*pom\.xml does not exist.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Open Source Software Security vulnerabilities detected
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Open Source Software Security vulnerabilities with CVSS score below 7.0 detected. Please get in contact with your security responsible.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Open Source Software Security vulnerabilities with CVSS score greater or equal.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: UI5 server not reachable.
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Probably the server from where the ui5 libraries are fetched is not reachable. This is an issue which is normally temporarily

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Cloud Upload Failure
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Cloud Upload Failed
The name must start with a lowercase character, followed by lowercase alphanumeric characters with a maximum length of 30 characters
Please create a DLM ticket on DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*The name must start with a lowercase character, followed by lowercase alphanumeric characters with a maximum length of 30 characters.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Testpage executed successfully but did not report any test results
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
With the switch from synchronous to async loading UI5 does no longer allow test html files which produce no test results.
Remove the test file in testsuite.qunit.html or qunit.runner.testsuite.html which does not contain any test or does not produce any test results

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*The test .*executed successfully but did not report any tests at all\. Please review your test content.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Overflow in ESLint check
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Typically happens when eslint tries to scan a minified 3rd party library in the repository. You need to exclude the 3rd party library from the eslint check as follows:
Create an .eslintignore file in your project's root directory. The .eslintignore file is a plain text file where each line is a glob pattern indicating which paths should be omitted from linting. However as we not only use ESlint but also the maven analysis-plugin, we need to make sure that the analysis-plugin checks also are disabled for the 3rd party sources. Currently we do not support glob patterns for the analysis plugin, i.e. you need to specify each file individually in the .eslintignore file.
Here is an example for a row in an .eslintignore file:
src/main/webapp/3rdparty/file1.js

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: WhiteSource - no dependencies defined
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: In package.json you need to define your open source libraries as dependencies. See here.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Virus scanner issue
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The Abap zip file could not analyzed because of Virus scanner is used. Create a DLM message under DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Archive can not be read because of virus scaner issues.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Codecheck Error APPDESCRIPTOR_INVALID_UNKNOWN_ACH
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The value of the ACH node in the App Descriptor is checked against the list of valid ACH components in I7P, transaction ACRF. The ACH needs to be in upper case letters and flagged as "BCP selectable".
For customer message processing it is important that the correct ACH component is maintained in the App descriptor. In future ACH will be used by the FLP when creating tickets via the support tool. It is also used in our /UI5/APP_INDEX_CALCULATE report on ABAP to display the responsible ACH when adding errors to the log.
The ACH components can be found in system I7P, transaction ACRF. Make sure that you enter a component which is selectable in BCP.

If you think this is a false positive, please proceed as described here

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: RELEASE_TASKS finished with ERROR
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Task can't be released . Retrigger the upload. This error occurs if a parallel upload into two systems is triggered.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: correction instruction missing
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
To ensure that a customer can notes via the correction workbench it is mandatory that in maintenance for each version of a Fiori app a corresponding correction instruction exists. Therefore before a new version can be uploaded into the ABAP system the system checks whether a version without a assigned correction instruction exists. In this case the upload is stopped. Solution: Go to system I7P and create the required correction instructions.
For details on the correction process refer here

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Locked in other request
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Objects are locked in another requests. The given request can't be used. You have to merge the correction into one patch or you have to wait until the other patch is released.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Missing required note
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: To ensure that a correct correction instruction can be generated it is mandatory that the last for customer released version of a App is available in the Hotfix system. Create DLM message under DEV-IW-GEN to triggered the installation of the required notes given in the log.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*must be implemented in the Hotfix system.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: wrong transport layer
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The generated workbench request is not compatible with assigned transport layer of the development package. Please create an DLM message under DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*No existing request can be used for change recording.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Error in ABAP Uplpad
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Check the build log for the stage. In case you can not find the root cause on your own, please create a DLM ticket in BCP for DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Translation Configuration wrong
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Something in the i18n.properties files or in the translation settings in pom.xml is wrong. Check the indications in error log for details

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Wrong Paths in Test Code
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
You set some wrong paths which let your tests not run. For more details, please check first pattern in the known issues section.
If you can not solve the the problem please create an issue

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Vyper Tests Failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Vyper Test has failed.
The details of the error is available in the "Vyper Test Report" which you can see on the left panel of the Jenkins build page.
If you can not solve the issue by yourself, please open an issue

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: TestNew...
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Description...Test

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: BSP name too long
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The BSP name is too long: maximum allowed length of BSP is 15 signs Please check the log and this wiki page to get information on how to fix.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: submit not allowed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Push to GIT repository failed due to lack of authorization
Solution: access the project portal entry of this project and click on "Administrate Gerrit Project". In Gerrit administration on the "Access" page of the project set „Rights Inherit From“ to „fnf“ then click on "Save for review". Make sure you add "Administrators" as Reviewer!

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*prohibited by Gerrit: not permitted: update by submit on refs/heads/master.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: User not registered in Gerrit
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The translation download/ or pom-updater job submits the changes to all users defined in the project portal under project leads and committers. At least one of the listed users is not known in Gerrit. Solution: The respective colleagues have to logon once to https://git.wdf.sap.corp:8080 (GLOBAL credentials). If the colleagues are not available, as work around you can remove them from the member list in project portal or define an extraordinary mailing recipient list as described  here.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: User Locked
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The user used for the deployment (fioinfra) is locked. Please create a DLM ticket to component DEV-IW-GEN in BCP.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*JCO Exception while trying to retrieve ABAP Destination: User is locked.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: B0X system not reachable
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The translation system was not accessible when the build started.
This is probably a temporary issue. In order to synch the latest translation please retrigger manually this build, else wait for the next automatic upload/download. Remember you need to be logged in to trigger a build.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Cannot establish connection to the translation system 'B0X'.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Wrong Parent Pom
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The parent pom defined in your pom.xml could not be found on the Nexus server. Please check whether you use an outdated snapshot version. For more information on the correct parent pom versions, please check this Wiki page

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Collection not assigned to a graph
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
In the translation system, the collection is not yet assigned to a graph
Contact your project's translation coordinator, have him or her assign the collection to the corresponding graph

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Collection .* is not assigned to a graph.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Obsolete dependency
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
In your pom.xml file there's a dependency to a parent or a library that could not be resolved. You either reference a wrong, non-existing version of the artifact or there's a temporary issue with Nexus
Check your pom.xml file for dependencies to non existing artifact versions, also check in Nexus if the artifact exists in the referenced version. If required, change the dependency (group, artifactIdD, version) accordingly, if you think the artifact is referenced correctly and there is an issue in Nexus create a DLM incident to component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*No versions available for .* within specified range.*
.*Some problems were encountered while processing the POMs.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Package does not exist
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The ABAP Package assigned to the project does not exist in the target system

Solution:

Check your configuration for ABAP upload in project portal. If the package there is the correct one, create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN to create the package.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Error: ABAP Package .* does not exist in the current system.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Releasing the transport failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
There was an error during release of transport
Check the log for details on the error cause. If you cannot fix the error yourself in the ABAP system, create a DLM incident to component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Gerrit voter job started without ChangeID
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Gerrit voter job was started manually without providing a valid Gerrit ChangeID See here

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Quality Issues
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Project has quality issues of category "Very High" or "High" Check the console log for details on the errors and correct the errors

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Test Failure
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: At least one of your Qunit/OPA5 tests failed. Please check the troubleshooting guide on how to fix the issue!

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No Translation Type for key
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
There's a key in the translation properties files with no translation type.
Please check this Wiki Page -> Each line needs to be prefixed with an SAP text type ...
If you cant fix the issue on your own, you may create a DLM Incident for SLS-OTS-MISC

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: \[ERROR\] The key .*' has no translation type.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Build aborted due to not running tests
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The build gets aborted after 10 minutes after the test runner started the browser. This means that the test runner started the test suite and did not proceed fur 10 minutes. One reason could be that the tests simply do not start at all. Best would be to debug the startup of the complete testsuite as described in the troubleshooting guide

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*asynchronous script timeout: result was not received in 600 seconds.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: User of Release coordinator missing in system
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The user to which the correction request should be assigned isn't existing in the upload system. Typically the user of the release coordinator isn't existing in the system. Solution: For the release coordinator a user has to be created via the user self service in the upload system. Request or unlock user via the Self Service (https://portal.wdf.sap.corp/go/devuser)

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*does either not exists or is locked in the system.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No hotfix needed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: A hotfix is only required if in the maintenance system a version from a milestone release codesplit (MRC) was uploaded. Check your ReleaseContext. Take the highest *SP* ReleaseContext

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*can not be uploaded into Hotfix system.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: transport with wrong client
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The assigned ABAP transport has the wrong client. Solution: Create a transport in client specified for UI5 FIORI application. The information can be found in the most cases on the logon screen of the ABAP system.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Transport request does not targets the upload client.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No manifest.json found to read ACH
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: No mainfest.json found in the root of nexus/*opt-static-abap zip file to read ACH Component. ACH is required for creation of correction measure. Solution: Relocate your manifest.json to the root of your project.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Not sufficient authorizations for upload
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The user is existing in the upload system but has not sufficient authorization to upload FIORI Apps

Solution:

-> The user with the missing authorization has to call DLM Cockpit ( https://dlm.wdf.sap.corp/systemcockpit/portal/ )

-> enter system SID.

-> navigate to User / Authorizations

-> enter client.

-> press button get User

-> With this the user will be actualized in the upload system

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Error from correction.*is not authorized to change requests.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Hotfix only required if in maintenance a higher minor version
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The upload of patches y.x.z+1 into the Hotfix system is only required if a higher minor version y.x+n.w was uploaded into the maintenance system. Solution: Check your ReleaseContext. Perform the upload into the maintenance system. Chose the highest *SP* ReleaseContext at the corresponding SingleAppFlow.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*can not be uploaded into Hotfix system. A hotfix is only required.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Projectportal not available
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The project portal is not available. Check information on the DLM Wikipage If you don't find here information about the issue, create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*https://projectportal.int.sap.hana.ondemand.com/api/projects/.*not found. Host reports a temporary problem: 503 Service Unavailable.*
.*https://projectportal.tools.sap/.*not found. Host reports a temporary problem: 503 Service Unavailable.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: pp-property-updater failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: pp-property-updater failed Solution: Retrigger the build. If the issue persists create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-RELEASEBUILD

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: success-mail failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: success-mail failed

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: abap upload failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The ABAP upload has an error. To get the error navigate into the link above the error.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: FIOINFRA locked by another process
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: To many Upload of user FIOINFRA are running parallel. Solution: Retrigger upload again.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*SAP names file for FIOINFRA locked by another process.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: gav_info failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
gav_info failed
Solution: Retrigger the singleAppFlow. If the issue persists create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-RELEASEBUILD

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: mrc failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: mrc failed Solution: Retrigger the singleAppFlow. If the issue persists create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-RELEASEBUILD

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: xmake call failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: xmake call failed Solution: Retrigger the build. If the issue persists create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-RELEASEBUILD

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: SYSTEM_CORE_DUMPED
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: During the upload exception SYSTEM_CORE_DUMPED was raised. This often occurs at problems with virus scan.. Solution: Retrigger upload again. If error stays create a DLM incident under DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: request is already released
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The assigned workbench request is already released. Solution: If required generate a new workbench request

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: LREP replication not possible because of locked objects
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
After upload into the BSP applications UI5 objects are replicated into LREP. During the replication the LREP objects have to be locked. This is only possible if no other replication e.g. from a scheduled job of the APP index calculation is running.

Solution:

--> trigger the upload to a later time. You can check whether the objects are locked with transaction sm12 in the upload system.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: package mismatch
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: In project portal entered development package is not same as development package which is assigned to BSP in target system. Solution: Change development package in project portal or create DLM incident under DEV-IW-GEN to relocate the FIORI App to another development package.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*ERROR: In project portal entered package:.*is not same as package:.*
.*entered package is not the same as in TADIR.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: invalid email adress
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: In the corresponding project an email under project members is maintained which does not exist, e.g. due to the employee as left SAP.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Error on sending Email: Invalid Addresses.*Address not found.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Deletion of object failed. Descriptor or variant is referenced by
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Error: Failed to delete descriptor of application FIN_AA_MSTR_WL from layered repository Deletion of fin.aa.master.worklist failed. Descriptor or variant is referenced by appconfig/vendor/F777874002D7540724ABAB49D20FC992.6F844F45234B150EFE6CE70E4917E8A3/ Solution: please create Ticket on CA-UI5-FL-LRP

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No destination to development system found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The system is not able to calculate the infinity system of the to the BSP assigned development package. One reason can be that the connection to the GTADIR was temporary not available Solution: Retrigger the upload. If the error occurs again, create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .* No destination to development system found.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: BSP has to end with S1
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
All BSPs in software component UIS4HOP1 and UIEPPMS4 has to end with S1.

Solution:

Check your configuration for ABAP upload in project portal. Change the name of the BSP to name ending with S1.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*All BSPs in software component UIS4HOP1 and UIEPPMS4 has to end with S1.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Original issue
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
One object can't be created due to the original is not assigned to the upload system. This is often a temporary problem.

Solution:

Retrigger the ABAP Upload. If the error occurs again create a DLM incident on component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*already exists globally with the original in.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: SICF node missing
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Error: SICF node OBJECT_NAME is missing Solution: delete BSP and create (upload) it again. Don´t do anything manually, all steps must be done by the Tools !

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Target group is not defined
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
The target group defined in projectportal of the corresponding project in not defined in Transport Management System (TMS)

Solution:

-->Adjust the TARGET in project properties of your project in projectportal

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: no local upload
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Upload into software component LOCAL or development package tmp is not supported

Solution:

-->If you want to upload an App which should not be delivered to the customers you have to upload into a HOME software component. For this can you use in system UYT(100) the software component UIERHOME. To get a development package in this software component create a DLM Incident on component DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Technical Error
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
In the upload tools a Syntax error occurs.

Solution:

--> Create a DLM incident on DEV-IW-GEN

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Package missmatch
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Package entered in projectportal is not the same as in ABAP system. Solution adjust package in project portal

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*entered package is not the same as in TADIR.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: no Transport Request Id
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
For a hotfix relevant release context the "Cloud Edition Hotfix Transport Request Id" is mandatory. Solution: Enter a Cloud Edition Hotfix Transport Request Id
For details refer here

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Page delitions found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Error: during upload pages of a BSP in the System will compared with pages in the Archive. Pages which are exist in the System, but not in the Archive, will be deleted also in the System. In the past this lead often to unsolvable problems in phase Maintenance, in case of re-creation of before deleted pages. The reason for this: deletion and re-creation cannot shipped with correction instructions in Notes. Because of this, deletion of pages in phase maintenance are denied ! You can delete the content of the pages, but not the pages itself.
Solution: delete the content and usage of the pages, but not the pages itself If deletion of pages is needed in any case, please open an BCP Ticket on DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: NO Release Context
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: No Release context is entered. For a SingleAppFlow is mantatory to enter a Release Context. Refer to the link for triggering the SingleAppFlow manually. Solution: Restart the SingleAppFlow with a Release Context. For questions contact your LOB release coordinator

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Error: No input found for parameter: Release Context.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: UYT not available
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Central FIORI app infinity system UYT is not available. Please check the status of the system on https://wiki.wdf.sap.corp/wiki/display/fiorisuite/Infrastructure. If you don't find information about UYT create a message under DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Obsolete parent pom points to B0Y
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The parent pom version you use is outdated and points to obsolete translation system B0Y. Use the newest parent pom version as listed here.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Cannot establish connection to the translation system 'B0Y'.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Branch not found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The branch was not found in GIT repository. Verify the repository and branch configuration for this job

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Parent pom version is not provided
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The new parent pom version is not provided properly; check your Project Portal Entry's properties!

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*the new parent pom version .* is not provided properly.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Archive not existing
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The Abap Zip file which should be uploaded is not existing in on Nexus. Solution: Retrigger the corresponding CI build or SingleAppFlow

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*version.json : Archive empty, corrupt, or IV_URL is wrong !.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: ESLint found an error
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
There is at least one linting error. The details of the error is available in the "ESLint Test Report" which you can see on the left panel of the Jenkins build page.
You may also check the console output log for the errors. All indication for fixing errors are in the log.
For more information please check here
In case you can not find a solution by yourself or think that this is a false positive, please create an issue

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Failed to get SAST scan results
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: No scan results could be retreived from Checkmarx server. This might be a temporary issue with Checkmarx server. For issues with the Checkmarx server open a ticket here , then choose "New Ticket" ==> "Checkmarx". Make sure you provide a link to the job log in the ticket.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No Code Found
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: The cloned git repository does not have folder webapp or src, looks like there is no code in your repository.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*No source folder src or webapp found.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Qunit OPA Tests - script timeout
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: As we run the tests via Selenium, there is timeout for all script interaction (e.g. testsuite discovery, read, pull of test). Please check here how to proceed.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: org.openqa.selenium.ScriptTimeoutException: asynchronous script timeout: result was not received in

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: testeg
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: .Description..

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Test Page does not exist
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: In your main test suite (e.g. webapp/test/testsuite.qunit.html) you refer to test page which does not exist. This could be either a typo or the file simply does not exist. Please correct the corresponding line in your test suite file.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Pipeline Configuration Not Schema Compliant
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Your pipelineConfig.yml is not schema compliant. Please check the schema from here here.
In case this is a false positive, please create an issue here here.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Karma Tests Fail
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Your QUnit/OPA5 Tests failed.
Please proceed as described here.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Wrong Repository Structure
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Your repository does not comply to the supported structure:
it must be one of
/webapp (default for apps)
/src/main/webapp (legacy apps)
/src (default fot libraries>
Other structures are not supported!

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*No source folder src or webapp found.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: ESLint internal failure
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Linting was unsuccessful due to a configuration problem or an internal error. Report is not generated. Please create an issue.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: ESLint check found an issue
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
There is at least one linting error. The details of the error is available in the "Checkstyle Warnings" report.
You may also check the console output log for the errors. All indication for fixing errors are in the log.
In case you can not find a solution by yourself or think that this is a false positive, please please create an issue

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: UIVeri5 Tests failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Your UIVeri5 tests failed. The details of the error is available in the " UIVeri5 Test Report" which you can see on the left panel of the Jenkins build page.
You may also check the console output log for the errors.
In case you can not find a solution by yourself or think that this is a false positive, please create an issue
For more information please check the docu for uiveri5 or
uiveri5Integration

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: ECMA 6 code detected
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
"const” is used in your JS code
Due due to the ES5 limitation of the Maven tools we don't support ECMA6 coding currently Only one we have rolled out Javascript transpilation step this would be supported In the meantime you need to change your code accordingly.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Fiori Dast Scan Failed
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Your Fiori Dast Scan failed.
Please check this page for known issues and instructions
If you can not solve the the problem please contact "DL S4HANA DAST Auditors"

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Timeout in Cloud Upload
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
Cloud Upload failed due to timeout.

Please check the DLM Wikipage for known issues in the landscape or create a DLM ticket on DEV-IW-GEN.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No Parent Pom defined
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description:
It is a prerequisite for a build that the right parent pom is defined in your pom.xml file - but there is none!
Please check this Wikipage for more details.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.pattern: .*Could not detect parent project in pom.xml.*

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: Project not in Project Portal
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Seems like your project is not registered in Project Portal yet. Currently we only support projects from Project Portal.

com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.name: No uuid found in i18n file
com.sonyericsson.jenkins.plugins.bfa.mod.description: Every test properties file (e.g. i18n.properties) must contain a unique uuid. Either there is no uuid file in one of your properties file or there is no i18n properties file at all. Please follow the instructions in this guideline
